verses.verse: Therefore leaving<WG863> the principles<WG746> of the doctrine<WG3056> of Christ,<WG5547> let us go<WG5342> on to perfection;<WG5051> not laying<WG2598> again<WG3825> the foundation<WG2310> of repentance<WG3341> from dead<WG3498> works,<WG2041> and of faith<WG4102> toward<WG1909> God,<WG2316>
Of the doctrine<WG1322> of baptisms,<WG909> and of laying<WG1936> on<WG1936> of hands,<WG5495> and of resurrection<WG386> of the dead,<WG3498> and of eternal<WG166> judgment.<WG2917>
And this<WG5124> will we do,<WG4160> if<WG1437> God<WG2316> permit.<WG2010>

For it is impossible<WG102> for those<WG3588> who were once<WG530> enlightened,<WG5461> and have<WG2192> tasted<WG1089> of the heavenly<WG2032> gift,<WG1431> and were made<WG1096> partakers<WG3353> of the Holy<WG40> Ghost,<WG4151>
And have<WG2192> tasted<WG1089> the good<WG2570> word<WG4487> of God,<WG2316> and the powers<WG1411> of the world<WG165> to come,<WG3195>

If they shall fall<WG3895> away,<WG3895> to renew<WG340> them again<WG3825> to repentance;<WG3341> seeing they crucify<WG388> to themselves<WG1438> the Son<WG5207> of God<WG2316> afresh,<WG388> and put<WG3856> him to an open<WG3856> shame.<WG3856>

For the earth<WG1093> which<WG3588> drinks<WG4095> in the rain<WG5205> that comes<WG2064> oft<WG4178> on it, and brings<WG5088> forth<WG5088> herbs<WG1008> meet<WG2111> for them by whom<WG3739> it is dressed,<WG1090> receives<WG3335> blessing<WG2129> from God:<WG2316>
But that which bears<WG1627> thorns<WG173> and briers<WG5146> is rejected,<WG96> and is near<WG1451> to cursing;<WG2671> whose<WG3739> end<WG5056> is to be burned.<WG2740>
But, beloved,<WG27> we are persuaded<WG3982> better<WG2909> things of you, and things that accompany<WG2192> salvation,<WG4991> though<WG1499> we thus<WG3779> speak.<WG2980>

For God<WG2316> is not unrighteous<WG94> to forget<WG1950> your<WG5216> work<WG2041> and labor<WG2873> of love,<WG26> which<WG3739> you have<WG2192> showed<WG1731> toward<WG1519> his name,<WG3686> in that you have<WG2192> ministered<WG1247> to the saints,<WG40> and do minister.<WG1247>
And we desire<WG1937> that every<WG1538> one of you do show<WG1731> the same<WG846> diligence<WG4710> to the full<WG4136> assurance<WG4136> of hope<WG1680> to the end:<WG5056>
That you be not slothful,<WG3576> but followers<WG3402> of them who through<WG1223> faith<WG4102> and patience<WG3115> inherit<WG2816> the promises.<WG1860>
For when God<WG2316> made<WG1861> promise<WG1861> to Abraham,<WG11> because<WG1893> he could<WG2192> swear<WG3660> by no<WG3762> greater,<WG3187> he swore<WG3660> by himself,<WG1438>
Saying,<WG3004> Surely<WG2229> blessing<WG2129> I will bless<WG2127> you, and multiplying<WG4129> I will multiply<WG4129> you.
And so,<WG3779> after he had patiently<WG3114> endured,<WG3114> he obtained<WG2013> the promise.<WG1860>
For men<WG444> truly<WG3303> swear<WG3660> by the greater:<WG3187> and an oath<WG3727> for confirmation<WG951> is to them an end<WG4009> of all<WG3956> strife.<WG485>

Wherein<WG1722> <WG3757> God,<WG2316> willing<WG1014> more<WG4054> abundantly<WG4054> to show<WG1925> to the heirs<WG2818> of promise<WG1860> the immutability<WG276> of his counsel,<WG1012> confirmed<WG3315> it by an oath:<WG3727>

That by two<WG1417> immutable<WG276> things, in which<WG3739> it was impossible<WG102> for God<WG2316> to lie,<WG5574> we might have<WG2192> a strong<WG2478> consolation,<WG3874> who<WG3588> have fled<WG2703> for refuge<WG2703> to lay hold<WG2902> on the hope<WG1680> set<WG4295> before<WG4295> us:
Which<WG3739> hope we have<WG2192> as an anchor<WG45> of the soul,<WG5590> both<WG5037> sure<WG804> and steadfast,<WG949> and which enters<WG1535> into<WG1519> that within<WG2082> the veil;<WG2665>
Where<WG3699> the forerunner<WG4274> is for us entered,<WG1525> even Jesus,<WG2424> made<WG1096> an high<WG749> priest<WG749> for ever<WG165> after<WG2596> the order<WG5010> of Melchisedec.<WG3198>
